aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon HealthCore Healthcare Platform Launch
Amazon launched HealthCore on 2025-09-25.
HealthCore is a comprehensive healthcare platform.
HealthCore promises to revolutionize patient care.
HealthCore integrates advanced medical technologies with Amazon's logistics expertise.
HealthCore integrates advanced medical technologies with Amazon's cloud computing expertise.
HealthCore combines telemedicine services.
HealthCore combines AI-powered diagnostics.
HealthCore combines same-day pharmaceutical delivery.
HealthCore combines personalized treatment plans.
HealthCore creates a seamless healthcare ecosystem.
The HealthCore initiative builds upon Amazon's acquisition of One Medical.
The HealthCore initiative represents a $10 billion investment in healthcare infrastructure.
The $10 billion investment will be made over the next five years.
HealthCore operates through a network of 500 medical centers.
HealthCore operates through 50 specialized diagnostic facilities.
HealthCore operates through partnerships with leading hospitals across the country.
HealthCore operates through partnerships with research institutions across the country.
Dr. Jennifer Walsh is Amazon's Chief Medical Officer.
Dr. Jennifer Walsh is a former Surgeon General.
Dr. Jennifer Walsh explained: "Healthcare should be as accessible and reliable as ordering a book online."
Dr. Jennifer Walsh stated that HealthCore eliminates barriers preventing people from receiving timely medical care.
Dr. Jennifer Walsh stated that HealthCore eliminates barriers preventing people from receiving high-quality medical care.
HealthCore serves patients in Manhattan.
HealthCore serves patients in rural Montana.

metadata.header_path: /Amazon Launches Comprehensive Healthcare Platform Revolutionizing Patient Care/
/Amazon Launches Comprehensive Healthcare Platform Revolutionizing Patient Care/

text:
## News Report

Amazon today launched HealthCore, a comprehensive healthcare platform that promises to revolutionize patient care by integrating advanced medical technologies with the company's logistics and cloud computing expertise. The platform combines telemedicine services, AI-powered diagnostics, same-day pharmaceutical delivery, and personalized treatment plans into a seamless healthcare ecosystem.

The initiative builds upon Amazon's acquisition of One Medical and represents a $10 billion investment in healthcare infrastructure over the next five years. HealthCore operates through a network of 500 medical centers, 50 specialized diagnostic facilities, and partnerships with leading hospitals and research institutions across the country.

"Healthcare should be as accessible and reliable as ordering a book online," explained Dr. Jennifer Walsh, Amazon's Chief Medical Officer and former Surgeon General. "HealthCore eliminates the barriers that prevent people from receiving timely, high-quality medical care, whether they're in Manhattan or rural Montana."
